column5: Hey Gang, I was just wondering if anyone can suggest some good pike lakes within an hour or so from Toronto for a day trip of fishing? Looking forward to getting out in my fishing kayak to get some action! I know Simcoe is a popular lake, but looking for a body of water that isn't so big. I'd appreciate any suggestions. Thank you, Glenn

You don't even have to leave TO...inside of the Leslie St spit has plenty of Pike with a shot at a 40 Other than that...within an hour of downtown ? A lot of the Conservation Areas have lakes with decent populations of hammer-handles.
Definitely no need to leave Toronto to catch some nice gators.
Thanks guys! I am hoping to find a smaller lake up north. I salmon fish through July/August so I see plenty of Lake Ontario! Glenn
Cooks Bay would be a good choice (Lake Simcoe)  Not a smaller lake though.

For conservation areas within an hour Mountsburg close to Guelph or Island Lake in Orangeville. These places get hammered pretty hard so expect a pressured fishery and plenty of hammer handles. If you’re willing to stretch the drive to 1.5-2 hours to the Kawartha’s, namely, Canal, Mitchell and Balsam Lakes hold some good pike. Reef
Thank you guys, really appreciate the suggestions! Glenn
